item.title: Une corde
item.description: Cemetery Without Crosses, is a 1969 Spaghetti Western film by Robert Hossein, its director, co-screenwriter and star.

item.title: Reverend's Colt
item.description: Reverend's Colt is a 1970 Spanish-Italian Spaghetti Western directed by León Klimovsky.

item.title: The Three Musketeers of the West
item.description: Tutti per uno... botte per tutti, internationally released as The Three Musketeers of the West, is a 1973 Italian spaghetti western-comedy film directed by Bruno Corbucci.

item.title: A Sky Full of Stars for a Roof
item.description: A Sky Full of Stars for a Roof is a 1968 Italian Spaghetti Western comedy film.

item.title: Seven Hours of Gunfire
item.description: Seven Hours of Gunfire is a 1965 Spanish-Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Joaquín Luis Romero Marchent.

item.title: Seven Guns for the MacGregors
item.description: Seven Guns for the MacGregors is a Technicolor 1966 Italian spaghetti western. It is the directorial debut film of Franco Giraldi, who was Sergio Leone's assistant in A Fistful of Dollars. The film gained a great commercial success and generated an immediate sequel, Up the MacGregors! (1967), again directed by Giraldi, and a later sequel, More Dollars for the MacGregors (1970).

item.title: The Relentless Four
item.description: The Relentless Four or I quattro inesorabili is a 1965 Italian Spaghetti Western film in Eastmancolor directed by Primo Zeglio.

item.title: Man Called Invincible
item.description: Man Called Invincible is a 1973 Italian spaghetti western-comedy film directed by Giuliano Carnimeo.

item.title: Holy God, Here Comes the Passatore!
item.description: Fuori uno sotto un altro... arriva il passatore is a 1973 Italian adventure-comedy film directed by Giuliano Carnimeo.

item.title: Bandidos
item.description: Bandidos is a 1967 Italian spaghetti western film. It marked the directorial debut in a feature film of the then cinematographer Massimo Dallamano.
